website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-use socket set also offers tough construction. Large collection to meet a variety of needs.
pros: Offers full protection from corrosion with polished chrome finish
Comprehensive set with pieces that come organized well inside the case
Uses proprietary technology to prevent slippage on stuck fasteners
Provides almost any type of socket you'll need
cons: Some pieces fit too tightly in the case and are tough to remove

customer_reviews.title: Good set of tools.
customer_reviews.text: Added a little color to the raised lettering with a paint marker. Now it's easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tools except for tiny socket size markings
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with this tool set overall. I did take another reviewers advice and repack the wrenches with grease. That made the ratchet action much smoother. For the price, the quality of the components seem good. I've mildly abused the 1/2 inch ratchet with a cheater pipe and it survived. The only reason I'm only giving 4 stars as the socket size markings are small and very hard to read. I'll have to improvise with some paint to ease identification. I don't understand why the manufacturer couldn't recognize the need to design legible sizing on the sockets.
customer_reviews.author: bimmer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a birthday gift for my husband. He was like a little boy on Christmas morning. He's already used it on our cars a couple times. For the price and the quantity of pieces included, you really can't go wrong with this set. Plus, according to Stanley's website, there is a lifetime warranty on all mechanics tools. Score!
customer_reviews.author: BridgettTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the ratchet as they freeze/lock up
customer_reviews.text: Sockets are fine and do the job but the bigger of the two ratchets is completely frozen. Very disappointed that it no longer 'switches' to tighten/loosen mode and does not actuate in any direction. Now I have to find a replacement for this ratchet. I have only used it twice before and I have owned this since March 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: good set for a car or rv
customer_reviews.text: good with a couple of comments 1. does not come with 7/16 wrench (most common size i use). i added a 7/16 wrench 2. deep sockets are not full depth 3. case is good but did have the steel pins on clasps come out and had to push back in 4. added paint marker to sizes on case so i could read the lettering 4. good for a car, but not a high quality home set. 5.pretty much a full assortment of 1/4 and 3/8 sockets 6. ratchets are ok ,but not great 7. good enough that bought a second one for another vehicle
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for working on the car or around the home.
customer_reviews.text: It's everything you'd need if you want to do some work on your vehicle or around your home and be a handyman. I've always liked Stanley because it's always a great deal; cheap price for pretty decent quality tools :) The case is very nice and holds everything in place, so you dont have to worry about losing anything. I'd definitely recommend this tool set, if youre just a simple guy like myself, it's a great tool set and I'm sure it'll last me years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: You can do better
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your $$$ on this set as it is loaded with stuff you will never use! Instead, find a set that has 3 ratchets, adapters, extensions, and DEEEP sockets from 3/8 to 1" If you have small equipment, find some deep spark plug sockets too, Finally, locate a separate wrench set to 1" and a screwdriver set that has quality flat and #2 and #3 bits. You will end up assembling a tool set that helps you can really fix stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expect from Stanley
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really used this much since getting it as a gift for Christmas 2018. While working on a major project these past few weeks using the 3/8 drive ratchet handle, it slipped out of my hand and fell maybe 4' to the deck I was on and broke apart with all of the guts coming out and going everywhere so now I need to get another 3/8 drive handle that will fit inside the case. Very disappointed in Stanley's quality or lack thereof. Bought this set because on manufacturers reputation. Guess I need to re-think that.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mercogliano

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: A solid set of tools that will last and wont break the bank. This is my second set i bought specifically to keep in the trunk of my '49. Ratchets are solid with little to no play. To the people complaining and giving a low rating because the bits spill out and make a mess when opening. There are latches that must be unhooked before you open this. If you cant determine which side of this case is the top and which side is the bottom when unlatching it, you probably shouldnt be working with tools anyway.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set based on the reviews and the ratchet mechanism lever to change from loosen to tighten broke the first time I used it. The mechanism is frozen and I can't put it in reverse. Luckily I only paid $20 for it but I'm disappointed. I can still use the sockets though. I had to go to Sears and buy a better quality ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Robitaille

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools. TERRIBLE case!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off with this. The tools that are included with this are of excellent quality! Now for the bad part. After a small drop in my garage, the case seam split in half making it practically useless for storage . It’s only a matter of time before it completely splits in half and I can no longer use it as a carrying case. You would think they could spend just a little bit more money making the case more durable. Instead of being a hinge reinforced by a metal pin, it’s just a piece of plastic that will break over time.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Davison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set...
customer_reviews.text: With much of my belongings still in storage after moving across country, I am also without most of my tools. This set is a lifesaver for addressing jobs in/around the house and for the car. As a previous owner of a much larger set, it seems to me most of what I've ever needed is in this Stanley set. Best part: the pieces all lock into place. If you've ever had the experience of owning other sets where the sockets don't lock, you know it's a nightmare when you open/close the case.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Have tools , will travel
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to expand my meager tool selection here at home and this did the job. Like other reviews suggest, you may want to acquire a paint or chalk marker to run over the labeling for each tool. They are just raised numbers on the black plastic and are hard to read. RATINGS GUIDE - 5 star - Item flawlessly performs its job and/or is a unstoppable great value. Buy it now! 4 star - Item does its job pretty good and/or is a reasonable value 3 star - Item does its job as expected and/or costs about average 2 star - Item leaves something to be desired 1 star - AVOID ITEM AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.author: Six

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend for anyone who wants to do some of their ...
customer_reviews.text: For $50, this tool set is a steal. Would highly recommend for anyone who wants to do some of their own auto maintenance. It's pretty much got everything you need. The sockets are high quality and it's got a nice range of hex/torx/screw driver bits for the 1/4-inch drive. The case is really nice, it's got a slim profile so its easy to store. The combination wrenches are just ok, but if you're doing a lot of auto work you'll probably want to upgrade to a full set any way. The hex wrenches are too short for my preference, so I just use them as a back up if my other tool bag isn't around.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Mayer

customer_reviews.title: but then I stopped and realized that it would be infinitely more annoying if the pieces came out of the case easily ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid and well-working. I was originally going to drop this to 4 stars and complain about how hard it is to get the pieces out of their slots in the case, but then I stopped and realized that it would be infinitely more annoying if the pieces came out of the case easily and rattled around. Perhaps with more use, the slots will loosen up. One thing, if you want to do a lot of work on your car, you will probably need a longer extension piece than the one that comes with this. I couldn't reach my spark plugs (spark plug sockets sold separately, FYI) and had to jerry-rig something together to get down in there.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: They did what I needed them to do without ever pushing them beyond those limits so I don't feel comfortable in saying what they
customer_reviews.text: It is what is says it is. I have yet to put these through "the ultimate" tests but they do what they're suppose to... at least to an extent. They did what I needed them to do without ever pushing them beyond those limits so I don't feel comfortable in saying what they can do ultimately.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Owens

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great buy. A 3/8" ratchet costs $12 alone. The case is sturdy and the pieces all stay in place. Most of the sockets (19) are 1/4" and will need the included adapter while there are only 10 3/8" sockets. The Specialty bits are 3 phillips head and three flat head screwdriver bits. There's a pdf that says the 40 piece has a spark plug socket, but mine doesn't, unless it's just one of the regular socket sizes. The back graphic does not mention it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to have in my fifth wheel while away from the house for work. It is a simple set, sockets, wrench and a couple accessories only but is very useful. I only needed the socket set so I went with the 50 piece set. Just what I needed! The case is also nice, I don't have to worry about sockets rolling around. Feels strong and well built, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: The usual Stanley quality-very good
customer_reviews.text: Mostly love it though sockets can be ridiculously difficult to remove from the casing. A long 3/8 extension would have been nice as well as a universal joint of 1/4 and 3/8 size. The 1/4 inch wrench's release button has been reduced in size from the thumb sized one on previous 1/4 inch Stanley wrenches with the same part number and this makes it harder to release the sockets. The case retaining clips are an improved design which are less likely to fatigue and snap off unlike earlier Stanley case clips. For the price this set is pretty unbeatable though I hope the 3/8 and 1/4 inch wrench has some loctite on the retaining screws.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael Loucas

customer_reviews.title: Great Set for General Automotive Work
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set. I have their 40 piece set for 10 years now, and this one seems comparable. The item I received seemed to be a previously opened item, as there was no screw to remove, the unit was zip-tied shut, there were greasy fingerprints all over the sockets and driver, and some of the sockets were sitting upside-down in the case. I checked that everything was present and accounted for, cleaned up the pieces, and am using it just fine. Perhaps it was a previously returned set, or perhaps Stanley's quality control just isn't what it used to be. Regardless, it's a great set, I keep this one in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Benihana

customer_reviews.title: Love this kit!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit. I carry it everywhere I go. I've repaired countless things with it including many Harleys, emergency roadside automotive brake jobs, emergency roadside fuel pump swaps, the list goes on and on. Now, it is not the only tool kit I carry around. It does not have everything needed to do all the work cited above by itself, but it is the heart of my tools that I carry around with me all the time. I originally bought my first kit from Walmart and loved it so much I searched for the exact same kit on Amazon when I came to need a second one.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for one of the kids and when it came I almost kept it for myself because it was so nice. This is a great starter kit for anyone and especially people who are starting out on their own. Also good as an add on for anyone that wants a good set of sturdy tools at their fingertips. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Taco Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for "medium" duty
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality socket set. Not as heavy duty as my old Craftsman socket set, but not cheap/flimsy. As has been noted in previous reviews, the sockets are set pretty firmly in the slots in the case - however, if you use the "screwdriver" converter handle, it's relatively straightforward to pop the sockets out of the case.
customer_reviews.author: dbjanes

customer_reviews.title: Came for the price, stayed for the quality
customer_reviews.text: These don't feel cheap at all. I've been a Craftsman Stainless guy since I was a kid, but these do the job plenty well. If they start failing at any point, I'll come update this, but they aren't chipping/staining, etc. They've got some serious engine work and a bunch of little stuff (brakes, etc.) under them already and they're just as good as anything out there.
customer_reviews.author: Weston Winn

customer_reviews.title: I consider this purchase to be an excellent bargain and am well pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the kit, there was just one loose socket, which snapped securely back into its spot. When in ther places they remain firrmly entrenched (unless you throw the case onto solid ground), which might have happened with the shipping facility. The kit has three closures, one in the front and one on each side, which keeps the case closed securely. Overall, I consider this purchase to be an excellent bargain and am well pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Iseley

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have around the house for light duty work. Has been used less than 10 times since it was new. Today, while assembling some furniture, the ratchet locket up and when I turned it over the switch gear fell out. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: B. L.

customer_reviews.title: Most useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this quite often than I originally thought, all the tools are made especially useful for most of the cars I've worked on. I'm not a car mechanic but it gets the job done for my daily overall use. Stanley is a great reputable brand that I trust as well. Overall, I'm satisfied. Highly recommend as a good starter tool set.
customer_reviews.author: MasterSushi

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set for my home car maintenance and etc
customer_reviews.text: By far the best tool set I had very good with the ratchet I like the feel and good click..all sockets are in good spots and like how it's laid out...clean organization...I also like how the box locks on left and right and the front in two places. Good security my old Craftsman had only one front latch and that broke had to tie it every time now..
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality tools
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality tools, work fine for light home uses. Only gripe I have is the case is huge compared to how many pieces are in the set. Also, the sockets have to be pried out of their snap in storage spots with a screwdriver!
customer_reviews.author: David Routhier

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! I used them to replace the spark ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I used them to replace the spark plugs on my car, remove/clean the overhead air intake manifold on the engine, and change my oil. They were put to the test yesterday with 9 hours of work, and they did a great job! I probably put about 30lbs of pressure to take off a spark plug, and they didn't even give me a sign that they'd break. Overall, VERY happy with this purchase. My only suggestion to Stanley is to make them magnetic so I could easily have the screws stay on...other than that, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C James

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, not great
customer_reviews.text: The price was lower than I'd expected. It turns out that the quality was also lower than I'd expected. I might have kept it but sent it back since there was a broken latch on the plastic case the tools are housed in. I replaced this Stanley product with a higher cost / higher quality version from Craftsman. It's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice set; don't particularly like the case
customer_reviews.text: As expected, except the case. I was hoping for a case that would keep the sockets secure and organized. Unfortunately, the recesses for the sockets are a bit shallow, and they don't all stay where they should when the case is carried around. Keeping sockets organized is a major pain, and this case doesn't quite do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. I've only used what is included so far to put some running boards on my wife's 4Runner and also to replace the horn in my Accord. The only issue I had with it was that 1 or 2 of the sockets are two small for their "snap-in compartments" so whenever I open it, I have to be careful not to have anything fall out. I believe there are some other reviews mentioning how this happens for various pieces as well, so there appears to be an obvious QA issue.. but what do you expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Manhatten

customer_reviews.title: trust Stanley
customer_reviews.text: The product came in ample packaging without any damage. I used it the next day to assemble some new equipment and it worked properly with all the ratchets and sockets. The only problem(small) is the sockets are sometimes hard to remove from the case,although that is better than them being so loose they won't stay in their place. This was a good price for so many tools.
customer_reviews.author: dimmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect motorcycle & car tool set!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for my Suzuki GSXR 600 and a Honda Civic Si. I like to work on my own vehicles and to do that I wanted a big enough tool set for both my vehicles that is inexpensive and has a good warranty. What sold me was the warranty. Free replacement on mechanic tool sets! If you are just starting out on getting tools this is a good set to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive socket set
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 other sets around the same time and have broken sockets on both of them. So far no broken sockets with the Stanley. Superior case design as well. The case on one of the other sets was long ago shredded. The other has some pretty good cracks and isn't long for this world. This is an excellent combination of price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Drac Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great set.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set. Of course came with pieces everywhere, almost expected with the shipping. The pieces appeared to be unused and brand new condition, unlike the reviews where the pieces were used, scratched or rusted. Everything seems of great quality. I can't wait to put the tools to use.
customer_reviews.author: Quintin Leonard

customer_reviews.title: These work fine for most things
customer_reviews.text: These work fine for most things. Already broke one though. Not the most durable. Case works, but is also not the best. Some sockets are in too loose and some are in a bit too tight. Perfectly fine budget set though.
customer_reviews.author: Kciwsolb

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: It's okay and only okay. The sockets fit snugly in the case which is nice but the markings for the size on the sockets are hard to read and not engraved very deep I see them wearing away quickly. The nice thing is it includes extensive reg/deep sae/metric sockets and a nice magnetic bit holder for the torx/hex bits. The hex keys do not fit snugly into the case they do fall out when you close the case. It's a good starter kit
customer_reviews.author: Big Foot

customer_reviews.title: great starter or travel tool kit
customer_reviews.text: gets the job done. case keeps everything separated . great for emergency trunk tool set. the direction switch on the ratchets is a bit easy to hit while using them in a tight space . the cheap bags for the alens broke before i even opened it and the set came open in shipping and was spilled all over the box.. still good tools
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL case
customer_reviews.text: Tools are fine for the price but the case is AWFUL! Items constantly fall out of place especially when first opened/closed. This makes for a disorganized repair attempt. At the same time, some items I actually need oftentimes don’t come out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dad in VA

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and was obviously used. Grease, light scratches, and fingerprints on the 3/8" ratchet and a few sockets. Small rust spot on one of the wrenches. Stanley appears to have made a decent mid-level set, but I'm very disappointed in Amazon's shipping/handling. Operationally it is not a problem, but poor form to provide a used product when you've paid for a new set.
customer_reviews.author: Kharloff

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but its a $20 set
customer_reviews.text: Only took a few days of use for the socket wrench to jam and lock up. Had to disassemble and rebuilt the insides to get it working again. Obviously these come with absolutely no grease on the inside, bit of a shortcoming imo. Since nothing actually broke and the wrench was fixable, I give 3 stars. Ain’t bad for $20, but don’t put too much trust into it.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: A bargain with quality
customer_reviews.text: What a deal! Got this on a deep price cut. Immediately found use for this kit. This is very good quality tools. Only thing I didn't like about it is that it's not easy getting the sockets out of the case . Have to use a screw driver to lift them out. Snapping them in wasn't so easy either. Still, a nice kit and more affordable than the kits at Home Depot. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: This One is a Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Everything stays in place. Items are a little difficult to remove with dirty gloves, but I just use a screwdriver to snap out my selection. A little annoying at first, but much preferable to parts flying everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: JOHN MAYHAN

customer_reviews.title: Okay socket set for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice socket set at a decent price. I'm not too satisfied with the black case it comes in. The allen wrenches fall out every single time I open it. Its also kind of hard to get the sockets out of the case. All in all for the price I can't complain, kind of wish I had spent a bit more money on something more quality, but this will hold me over til I can afford something nicer. Definitely works well, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: The Righteous Priest

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: Just opened my set and was a bit dissapointed to see rust on several pieces. Some were very rusted, some a few spots.
customer_reviews.author: Justin J.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and functional, with few overlapping sockets or pointless ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable and functional, with few overlapping sockets or pointless redundancies (Craftsman tool sets, I'm looking at you.) My main complaints run thus: some of the indents for sockets are quite loose, and will not keep their sockets in place-primarily the 6, 7, 8, and 9mm deep sockets in the bottom of the upper half of the clamshell-and you cannot remove one set of screw bits without removing all four.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of tools that are perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of tools that are perfect for my needs. I'm sure they'll provide years of use. As for the case, I had to ask Amazon to ship me another set, because the original one wouldn't hold some of the pieces in place. They'd just fall loose inside and rattle around. Unfortunately, the second one had the same issue but held more pieces in place than the first. I accepted it as a manufacturer's flaw and kept them. To me, organization is important so for the lack of holding some items in place, I gave it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Note that the spark plug socket is a little snug and at first it doesn't seem like the plug will fit in the socket for insertion
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a metric and imperial socket set and this Stanley unit has come in handy for some spark plug changes and other various jobs around the house. Note that the spark plug socket is a little snug and at first it doesn't seem like the plug will fit in the socket for insertion and extraction. After working it into the socket, the grommet inside has seemed to widen a bit which is good. Quality seems pretty good and I was happy with the price considering the amount of sockets you get
customer_reviews.author: Daaaave J

customer_reviews.title: Great.  Everything I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Exactly what I was looking for. Only complaint is that the sockets are some times a bit difficult to pop out of their holders. Otherwise, it has all sizes I need in both deep and shallow well, the ratchets are really nice, they seem high quality and I like the fact that the sockets lock into place, with the button you have to press to release them. Also, switching between tighten and loosen is really easy. Great, easy to open case.
customer_reviews.author: Coulter Livforpeeps

customer_reviews.title: Great socket set.
customer_reviews.text: Tools work great but shortly after getting them the 1/4 drive randomly gets selector moved to middle, while in use, so that causes it to not ratchet. Other drives have had no issues. Only lose one star because it still works great it's just an annoyance while using it to have it stop ratcheting randomly. Also the case has 4 or 5 sockets that won't stay in the case due to loose slot being a bit loose. So each time you open it the same sockets are just laying in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Locosiete

customer_reviews.title: There is a good variety of tools in here
customer_reviews.text: There is a good variety of tools in here, and the quality seems good. The allens always fall out of their holder in the case, but most everything else seems to stay put pretty well. I thought it was a good value to a simple tool set to keep in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: MotorcycleEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: For the average DIYer it is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Decent Quality. Has withstand-ed a good amount of force. For the average DIYer it is perfect. I took out one star because two of the tips came in a little dirty with a but of rust on the inside. Not really a big deal they have probably just been sitting in a warehouse for 1000 years and got a little moist. Besides that I would recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter socket wrench set
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as it should and provides excellent torque. It's well made and saves me tons of time with home improvement projects. The L-shape is key in getting the necessary torque and also makes it easier to fit in small spaces. If you are trying to screw in something that is hexagonal, I'd highly recommend you use this socket set.
customer_reviews.author: Wing

customer_reviews.title: Great! Good price! 123 pieces of quality!
customer_reviews.text: Both hex felt each time and the spark plugs socket is hard to use when new, but two uses after, it gets easier. Everything still great after months, only the screwdriver mini sockets get rusted really quick, thats normal if you leave it outside. I don't like how tight are the sockets sometimes, but it's preferred than freely ones that you could easily lose. Gread quality. I got two longer extensions. I'll get a flexible adaptor and a T set to complete this package.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Good set for home use
customer_reviews.text: Needed some tools primarily for my bike. Figured I go for a slightly larger set in case I needed them for projects around the house. The tools themselves seem decent. The plastic case is fairly crappy. But I wasn't surprised by that. Just annoying that some sockets just fall right out and others almost need to be pried loose. But the tools work and that's the main thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set because I inherited a broken down F250 and I was tired of borrowing tools from my friends. This has just about everything you need at an amazing price and the quality is not bad either. The carrying case fits right behind my truck seat, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: We had to get a replacement because the first one ...
customer_reviews.text: We had to get a replacement because the first one we received was missing the 10 mm and had 2 3/8 wrenches. There was also a problem with the sockets staying in the correct place. I am also missing the 12 & 13 mm 1/4 sockets but have extra 12 & 13 mm 3/8 sockets. Will try to get the correct product for the 3rd time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for most people
customer_reviews.text: Great set (or at least good for me) I'm no huge DIY type but I do some things I need tools for. Had a really cheap set I used and someone stole it. Decided this was a good way to upgrade. Its complete as I need and for what the majority of people will ever need at home. With the lifetime replacement Stanley has it will more than do the job. Case is great keeps everything organized and seems to have 99.9% of the sizes. Should be good unless you are doing a business in used cars or something.
customer_reviews.author: talonmedic

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: We didn't drop test it so we could complain about how cheap the case was. Instead, we sat in on our dryer so we could use the tool to take off the top panel to the washer. And it works as intended! In total, we experience 0 problems with it, so it does indeed get 5 stars. We then stowed it where we could find it, should we need it again. Easy day.
customer_reviews.author: IMCisneros

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these I really needed a new set and it seems high quality. One socket and will not stay put in the case but it’s not really a problem
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Great selection of sockets
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. Great selection of sockets, wrenches and various screw drivers. Helped out with battery changes in two vehicles. Get an extension bar or two for longer reach.
customer_reviews.author: RTH

customer_reviews.title: happy husband!
customer_reviews.text: my husband only needed to replace the case on his super huge craftsman set but i couldnt find any. i settled on this and he says the compact size, quality finish and size selection were worth just spending the money and replacing his other set. he already had to use and loves them. thanks .. happy hubby.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good kit, wrenches need deburring though
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid toolkit. All of the sockets and bits felt substantial and like they would be able to take somewhat of a beating. The wrenches could have used a more smooth finish, they felt like they were forged and hardly deburred after, but still solid feeling also.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent durable set for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this set, this time as a gift for my brother. The quality of these tools is amazing. The case is what sold me the most. I hate having to use friend's socket sets now because their case has failed and the sockets are loose or unorganized. This case securely holds each tool, each socket, each adapter firmly in place for quick and easy use. At this price, you can't beat the combination of a sturdy, well-organized case, and top-notch tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mr McC

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a returned item but still functions
customer_reviews.text: Good set. I was sold a returned item as I’m missing one bit and the Allen wrench bag was ripped. Also the sockets were all over the place when I first opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amit S.

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Socket Sets FOR THE WIN!
customer_reviews.text: This tool kit has come is VERY handy for several DIY jobs I have conducted on my vehicles. I highly recommend purchasing any of the available set counts, though I chose to purchase the 40-piece as it has proven to be a very worthwhile investment, especially given the price and quality of the included components.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose set.
customer_reviews.text: High Quality, well made set. Bought one to keep around the house, liked it so much I bought another to keep at my offsite garage.
customer_reviews.author: dktrdktr

customer_reviews.title: Case and tools are great, was just missing a couple pieces
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for Christmas. Case and tools are great, was just missing a couple pieces. He wasn't worried about it because he had them anyway but its a little frustrating to not receive the entire collection. Not worth the hassle to try and get them from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at a Great price
customer_reviews.text: Strong tools that feel quality in your hands. I used the ratchet to remove some rusted on bolts. I had to use a cheater bar and apply a great deal of force. I never felt as if the handle would break or the socket threads would strip. A cheap no name tool would have broke. A different name brand tool would have cost a bit more (and some of those are garbage as well). Overall, very pleased with this set.
customer_reviews.author: SadieRocks

customer_reviews.title: Stanley is definitely a go-to from now on.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Tons of tools for a low, low price. But don't be fooled - low price doesn't always mean low quality. Sockets are definitely bulletproof compared to some I have used previously. *cough* h4rb0r fr3ight *cough* I would have been stuck and unable to finish multiple jobs had I not purchased this tool set. Absolutely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: br0

customer_reviews.title: but it is very nice to have such a large assortment in a compact ...
customer_reviews.text: The set showed up - sealed and brand new - with one of the sockets missing. I called Stanley and after asking me a few questions to ensure they were sending me the correct piece, they promptly sent me the missing socket and I had it in approx a week. I really haven't used the set much as it is something that I more-less need to keep around for odd jobs, but it is very nice to have such a large assortment in a compact case.
customer_reviews.author: TheGoodLife

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband as an anniversary gift. He is very pleased with the quality and the pieces offered in the set.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description of tools included in the Questions and Answers section for the 40pc kit
customer_reviews.text: The description of the parts included in the Questions and Answers for this product is not accurate. I bought this because the parts list said it includes a 13/16" socket, which it does not. The largest socket included is 11/16". Please list an accurate parts inventory for this kit.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, no surprises, a good product made well.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a basic 40 piece socket set! And it’s made by Stanley, so you can count on it being pretty solid. I’ve already used this to repair my windshield wiper transmission/linkage, and of course it held up well, and is still in good shape over half a year later.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrowhawk

customer_reviews.title: Stanley 85 Piece Socket Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice home set with lots of variety in socket sizes. However the largest deep wells are 1/2 inch and a 13 mm. I would have liked the SAE size deep wells to have included a 9/16 and 5/8 in the set. The largest shallow wells are a 11/16 and a 17mm which is fine. You do need some type of tool to help pry out the short sockets, I just used an old small / small bladed screw driver and stuck it in behind the deep wells to lock it in place. That way it's on hand and easy to access.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Rachet did not work
customer_reviews.text: The rachet's control switch to change direction (loosen/tighten) is jammed and I could not change it.
customer_reviews.author: rarewire

customer_reviews.title: Handy - Compact Toolset for your Car
customer_reviews.text: Very simple-does most-easy basic fixes you will need. Pretty handy, compact Stanley tool kit. All the bits and both Metric and Standard sockets necessary - and even the most common 8MM and 10MM sockets!
customer_reviews.author: Brian San Diego

customer_reviews.title: good comprehensive tool kit
customer_reviews.text: good comprehensive tool kit, the ratchet bits and heads fall out from their little spots when you open and close the lid however, doesn't affect function, but the case is annoying to live with.
customer_reviews.author: lurkbob

customer_reviews.title: Stanley tools are the best
customer_reviews.text: Superior tools, heavy duty. Lifetime warranty they will replace anything that breaks just to show how confident they are in their products. Stanley is highly trusted by my household for almost all the tools, even flashlights
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: A few pieces were missing. The pouches that the ...
customer_reviews.text: A few pieces were missing. The pouches that the allen wrenches came in were split. The pockets that the sockets click into were loose so many fell out during shipment. The engraving on the sockets for size indication are small and hard to read when theyre clean and become harder when covered in oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little too set. It has most of the tools you'll need in case of an emergency. I do have to say that it isn't a complete set because some pieces jump in sequence size, but it will do in a pinch and is a great addition to an emergency kit for your car.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Set
customer_reviews.text: Got these just in case I had any issues on my road trip. Compact and has almost everything you could need. Quality seems to be great. Definitely a great value for anyone looking for a budget mechanics set.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hallam

customer_reviews.title: Great, except the tiny size engravings.
customer_reviews.text: I love this set, except that it's very difficult to read! The size engravings on the sockets are tiny and very thinly etched. Had I known this before purchasing I would have gone with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Brumley

customer_reviews.title: simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for installing book shelves and tv wall mount and so far it has worked perfectly. Case definitely helps in keeping things well organized.
customer_reviews.author: Syed Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Great Set, Nice Case
customer_reviews.text: I got this set for the large assortment of ratchet sizes and wrenches. However, it also comes with a handful of regular wrenches and some allen wrenches. The case is very good, lightweight too. My only complaint is that the pieces are fairly difficult to get out of their slots and to put back, but it isn't something I would consider preventing me from buying this set. Just used it to work on my car and to change my oil and everything worked great and the sizes I needed were there. Great buy for average jobs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Xmas and my husband uses these from minor auto to things on the honeydo list. Nice set😋
customer_reviews.author: 40+Budget Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Basic set
customer_reviews.text: Great at home tool box, if you don’t have the tool in here it’s probably too much for you.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkbait

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and high quality
customer_reviews.text: For $17 you can’t beat it, the ratchet is actually pretty nice and held up to swapping the suspension on my car. I guess I got lucky because everything in the case stays in place. The ratchet is nice and beveled and doesn’t kill your hand with sharp edges. Sockets aren’t exactly something to beat on, but they work well for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality all inclusive set, they will work well for the average home owner or as a set for the car. ITs a bit hard to read the sizes, you can buy stickers. Even filling the etching w markers is not good enough for old guy eyes.
customer_reviews.author: dmann

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set!
customer_reviews.text: A couple of other reviews I saw stated that when they received the tool set it had finger prints on them like they had already been used, but I didn't notice that on mine. This set was exactly what I needed due to having other sets that didn't include a box and then I'd end up losing sockets. Plus, the lifetime warranty is nice. Will definitely be buying more tools.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Stanley STMT71651 85-Piece Socket Set
customer_reviews.text: Decent set. Sockets are well finished and accurate. Ratchet handles, both 1/2" and 1/4" are ok, but the polished end can get slick with either sweat or grease, the socket locks are a little stiff and the reversing switch is easy to hit accidentally while turning a nut or bolt. Everything also fits very tightly in the case. I find myself having to pry out some sockets, but I suppose that will loosen up with time. A good value but I'm considering substituting the ratchets.
customer_reviews.author: dick

customer_reviews.title: Great set to have around
customer_reviews.text: Great set to have around. I needed another set for the car and work. Remember, you get what you pay for. -Kyle
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great tools
customer_reviews.text: Little disappointed that some of the sockets won’t stay in their slots when closing case. Allen wrench bags were brittle and broken upon receipt. But still a great set of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: I just received these and I'm happy with the quality of this socket set
customer_reviews.text: I just received these and I'm happy with the quality of this socket set. The negative part about this item is the poorly designed case. Every time I go to shut it, a socket or two falls out. It does not hold them in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great little socket set for the price. I bought this so I can work on my truck easier and it works great. Does what is supposed to and looks like it will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: No more buckets. A little slick with greasy hands but you can coat handles in rubber.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I picked this set up. No more scrounging around in buckets for all my sockets. I put these to good use already by changing the spark plug out of a 93 Buick Regal. They hold up really well. I do wish it had better grip though with greasy hands. But you can dip the handles in a cheap rubberized coating if it becomes a big problem. For the price it's hard to beat it this quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality... Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured. They have some weight to the pieces. Used today on my car as soon as i got them. Worked wonderfully. The size of the case is perfect. Nice fit in my prius trunk. Will be buying more products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Foolproof warranty anything happens to it it's covered
customer_reviews.text: Great tools reminds me of the army rugged tough and Unpretty would recommend highly and product arrived 2 days before it was supposed to super fast shipping was so impressed I would recommend this to my family
customer_reviews.author: John McKinney

product_meta.title: Stanley STMT71652 123-Piece Socket Set,Black
product_meta.description: Size:123-PieceThe STANLEY STMT71652 123pc Socket Set offers a complete range of SAE and metric-sized sockets and drive tools. Our socket sets combine the most popular tools for easy accessibility. Stanley drive tools are forged from high-quality steel and finished in high-polish nickel chrome or black chrome. Selected ratchet handles are ergonomically designed and have an easy-to-use, thumb-operated reverse-switch mechanism. Sockets and extensions remain locked onto the drive until disengaged with an easy-to-reach, low-profile quick-release button. Stanley sockets feature our Max-Drive design, a unique radius corner design that provides 15% more torque* to tighten fasteners easily and simplify the turning of rounded corners. Max-Drive helps reduce fastener wear by minimizing contact on the outer 5% of the fastener, helping to increase life expectancy. It also helps reduce slipping on frozen or rusted fasteners. All Stanley ratchets, sockets and wrenches are manufactured globally to Stanley specifications, meeting and often exceeding ANSI specifications.
feature_bullets: Chrome Vanadium forged body for torque, strength and durability
Quick release switch and reversible mechanism for easy operation
Chrome Vanadium forged body for torque, strength and durability
Full polished chrome finish for anti-corrosion protection
Quick release switch and reversible mechanism for easy operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,108 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
